page.title: 09Garvald Church Congregation
page.content: The congregation is united with that of the neighbouring village of Morham and linked with the West Church in Haddington. One Minister, who lives in Haddington, serves all 3 churches and services are held alternatively in Garvald and Morham. Holy Communion is celebrated 4 times a year. The attendance has increased recently and there is an average congregation of 25 adults and 12 children, who go out to Sunday school in the second part of the service. There are about 120 full members of the congregation, half of whom live in the parish. The neighbouring stables are used for socials and barbeques for the congregation and groups who come out from Edinborough etc. to enjoy a rural retreat. On Christmas Eve almost everybody in the village joins in a nativity and carols on the green.
